level.text: The Board may conduct closed meetings for the purposes described in Section 405(b) of the Open Meetings Act, including the following:

Personnel matters, including the recruitment, appointment, employment, assignment, promotion, discipline, compensation, removal, or resignation of employees, or other individuals over whom it has jurisdiction;
Legal counsel briefings on litigation strategy;
Matters which would result in the disclosure of information specifically exempted from disclosure by statute;
Matters which would result in the disclosure of trade secrets and commercial or financial information;
Matters which would involve a clear and unwarranted invasion of privacy, an accusation of a crime, or formal censure; and
Matters which would result in the disclosure of investigatory records compiled for law enforcement purposes.
